===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|そ|yomi=o}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=そ|{{IPAchar|/t͡ʃɨʌ<sup>X</sup>/}}||a wooden stand used in offering rites}}.  Compare modern {{cog|yue|-}} reading ''zo<sup>2</sup>''.

{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|そ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|そ}}

# a {{l|en|sacrificial}} {{l|en|altar}}
# a {{l|en|cutting board}}, a {{l|en|chopping board}}

=====Usage notes=====
This reading appears to be less common.  For the {{m|en|cutting board}} sense in particular, the ''manaita'' reading below is more common.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|俎%上|そ%じょう}}: on the {{l|en|altar}}, on the {{l|en|cutting board}}
* {{ja-r|俎%豆|そ%とう}}: a ceremonial object in ancient China; {{l|en|etiqutte}}, {{l|en|manners}}
{{der-bottom}}
